question: 冷たい
sourceMnemonic: Something that is <kanji>cool</kanji> is <vocabulary>cold</vocabulary>. This refers to something that is <vocabulary>cold to the touch</vocabulary>, not the weather or something like that (which is <ja>寒い</ja>).
sourceReadingMnemonic: Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's mnemonic to help you: Something that is really <vocabulary>cold</vocabulary> to the touch is cold enough <reading>to ma</reading>ke ice cream with.
